website_summaries.verdict: Cook omelettes easily with DuPont Teflon and strategic angles.
pros: We love how this pan focuses on cooking evenly
Aluminum construction with stainless steel bottom
Uniform results are achievable for new and seasoned cooks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pan
customer_reviews.text: Excellent beyond compare. Go for the larger size. Not only does it make flawless omelets but you can also make very fine crepes to use as crepes or without sugar in the batter as a roll or manicotti or wraps.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This pan is excellent! It's got a nice weight to it but not too heavy that it's hard to use; you can tell it's high quality. The nonstick coating is really nice too. I used a small amount of oil as my standard practice but nothing stuck to the surface! Please see picture of "atsuyaki tamago" (Japanese style fried egg) to see how well the pan worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: CAJ

customer_reviews.title: Toy not tool
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for here. Good value for your dollar but it's not an everyday tool. I love making Japanese omelettes and this makes a good omelette in that manner. It's too small to cook for a family of four or dinner party but it is great for the money. Long term use confirms that the heated handle problem is real; I'm a dedicated cooking enthusiast and I've burnt myself on that handle a few times, once badly. Under long term everyday use the center of the pan warped convex, this is just not created for every day use. I will buy this again but I won't make the mistake of using it for anything but Japanese Omelettes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Moore

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for good quality Tamagoyaki-pan
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for good quality Tamagoyaki-pan, this one is not too heavy and just right size for making Tamagoyaki (Japanese omelet ). Nonstick, easy to clean. Just what i wanted! Make sure oil the pan good even it says Nonstick if you want to make perfect Tamagoyaki.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetiekitty

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: A fabulous little pan that makes tamagoyaki making a cinch! I love how the non stick surface allows the egg to be rolled easily with a minimum of fuss. I've been making my mom omelettes on my day off about once a week each time the pan cleans up easier than the rest of the kitchen. Seems to be durable enough but I'm not exactly hard on my stuff.
customer_reviews.author: sweetmusic

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pan for a couple months now and it still looks and works like new, no problems with the nonstick. I've only made tamagoyaki over medium heat, haven't exposed it to high heat so I couldn't say how it'd work for higher heat uses. But it works really well for what it is made for, and it's beautiful too. My favorite thing is that the (screws, rivets, whatever you call them) that connect the handle to the pan are also covered with the nonstick so egg doesn't get stuck around them like it does on my other pans.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Causes cancer! Google what Teflon does
customer_reviews.text: These pans have false advetisement PTFOA or PTFE Or TEFLON is all the same thing. It causes cancer!, it causes birth defects!, it causes learning dissability!, it’s proven hence why there was a class action lawsuit against the Teflon manufacture DuPont and many others, 3M. This stuff if ingested will leave you and your family vulnerable to cancer and health issues that are not normal. Our drinking water is also contaminated in most cities and this new Teflon is called GENX which is shown to have the exact same defects and health issues to animals, humans, etc. Google this it’s a current event and the companies new about this and still sell it because of federal laws not being changed!
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a black residue all over!
customer_reviews.text: Update 2/10/19: Leaves a black residue all over your hands! It’s not dishwasher safe. Great non stick pan especially if you are cooking for one.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great pan!!! It's high quality and non stick. Love using it to make eggs, although I'm still getting the hang of how to roll the egg right. The key I'm finding is low heat (to keep it from getting crispy), light layer of egg and when it gets almost all cooked through to the top start rolling. I got the smaller size not the really big one, I think unless your like supper hungry or feeding lots of people then just get the smaller one. I find its perfect size, even though it might seem small compared to regular a skillet, this is a good size for its task.
customer_reviews.author: Christina O

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The metal disc on the bottom transmits heat through the pan in a circle. The pan is square, thus the corners are cold when you heat it on an induction cook top. The eggs over cook in the middle while the corners barely warm up. Amazingly defective design...worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY THE FINEST QUALITY. ADE
customer_reviews.text: PREVIOUSLY I HAVE PURCHASED THIS PAN AND ORDERED FURTHER ONES FOR FRIENDS. IT IS SO SOLID, IT IS NEARLY INDESTRUCTIBLE , AND IS AESTHETICALLY PLEASING FOR DISPLAY IN ANY VENUE. FOR A SOUFFLÉ, AN OMELETTE, OR A SMALL STEAK OR CHOP, OR BREAST OF VEAL OR CHICKEN , ONE CAN NOT SURPASS IT. THE PAN ARRIVED EARLY IN ONLY A FEW DAYS AND WAS PACKED EXTREMELY WELL IN A TALL, HARD BOX. IGNORE ANY POOR REVIEWS, I WOULD NEVER LEAD YOU IN THE WRONG DIRECTION. AMAZON BACKS ALL ITS PRODUCTS, SO NO CUSTOMER EVER NEED WORRY. A GOOD DEAL OF COOKING IS DONE IN MY HOUSE AND I BUY ONLY QUALITY PRODUCTS. ENJOY.
customer_reviews.author: WALT

customer_reviews.title: Eggsellent!
customer_reviews.text: I used other non stick pans for my rolled egg, but this pan made it super easy to use and the tamagoyaki turned out eggsellent! The pan will make a single serving which is perfect for my bento box, so be sure you check the size of the pan before ordering. I also like that the pan is durable (doesn’t feel cheap) and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: AndroidFan

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Small but can prepare a perfect square omelette that has up to 4 eggs. You can probably use more eggs, but it may be difficult to flip past 4 and you will need to make a secondary smaller omelette. Non stick soneasybto flip eggs and Easy to clean as well. Took less than 2 minutes to clean and no damage to pan due to using wooden or plastic utensils. 100% recommend for making a smaller omelette for 1 person. Or if you are ok making more than 1 for multiple people. If you are trying to make one large omelet to share, I'd fer the bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Chibijulie

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: Well all was initially going well, I thought "What an amazing pan" hands down a winner. Now that I have been using it awhile I have noticed an issue with the bottom arching a bit instead of staying flat. If you are cooking eggs (fried) you can see where the inside is uneven, so perhaps using it on a glasstop stove would be significantly better than on gas? I'll continue to use it for omlets though.
customer_reviews.author: JD UT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I like this pan for the following reasons: NON STICK: YES! 1. It is non stick. I put very little oil but it was not a problem. I was succeed the first time making Tamagoyaki. It was fun! And very easy to clean after. ROOM FOR SPATULA 2. The further part of the pan is not 90 angle. It allows more room to stick my spatula in and roll the omelette. ELECTRIC STOVE: 👌OK 3. It can be used in electronic stove. RECOMMENDED All in all, I would recommend it to everyone. I brought the small size one. And it’s good for one and two people.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaZ

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful solid pan! Fun to make omelettes!
customer_reviews.text: Never had one of these before and where has it been all my life! Cooking for one over here and each roll has to be exactly 2 eggs. You could maybe get away with using 3 eggs if you're only using cheese as a topping. The first time using it was a little rough but it was easy to get a hang off the 2nd time around. I like to put my fillings in for the first rolling. Really love making rolled omelettes now. It's a nice solid pan with an element on the bottom that seems to pick up heat very nicely. I ordered the medium so if you're cooking for 2+ get the large.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Momma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use with a hotplate when a microwave isn’t available!
customer_reviews.text: This review actually goes along with:  since I bought them to use together. I’m going to Zion NP this fall, & staying in a room that doesn’t have a microwave to make dinner. Since they allow hotplates, I bought this to use with it. It’s perfect for my needs! No need to use anything to prevent your food from sticking. Washes up in about 1 minute using hot, soapy water. No mess, no fuss! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris JungTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: We use this pan more than any other we own.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has used this pan almost every day since she bought it (couple months now). The inside nonstick is great and you dont need to use much if any oil to cook eggs. I have no problem cleaning the inside with sponge and soapy water but the underside of the pan has small ridges and gets scorched by the burner making it hard to get super clean. I love making crepes in this pan as it heats really evenly and doesn't tear like in our regular pans. The square shape makes it great to have folded omelets with the good stuff all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: Askjok

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I was expecting bigger size but it’s ok,,, Used 4 eggs to make rolled up egg ;) Just need to add ketchup and yum!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Overall is good but may not be best for the induction stove
customer_reviews.text: Overall is good but may not be best for the induction stove. Only the center circle area is induction sensible. I feel it heats a bit slow and the corner area is not as evenly heated (compared to other stainless induction stove pod/pan I have) to make the Tamagoyaki a bit challenging. Now I use it more for regular non-stick usage. I bought the larger size of it. Maybe buy the smaller size to have the center heated area just about the same size as the pan bottom would work.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Another quality TeChef pan for my collection.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this TeChef - Tamagoyaki Japanese Omelette Pan based on other quality pans I have used from this company. I love eggs and have used this pan to make the most delicious and beautiful rolled omelettes. Anybody who tried these rolled omelettes has raved about the delicate texture and many layers. The pan has been super easy to clean and makes me want to buy other pans from TeChef.
customer_reviews.author: KarpeTech

customer_reviews.title: Omlets galaore!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted to cook Omlets that she could fold over easier that if she was using a round pan, so she asked for this one. She's 11. So it's light enough for a younger person to handle, she's able to clean it. It was a great buy, good quality, and love the food that's coming out of it. No issues with food sticking or having to scrape that we have found. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.text: I was sent a silver tamagoyaki pan. The handle says Techef on it but I even looked at their website and this color/style is not even listed as a product on there.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: The pan has a good weight indicating they did not skimp on the metal thickness. This is much better than those imitation pans made in China which are thin and very lightweight. The quality is very good and you can tell this is designed and manufactured very well. Eggs come off very easily. Easy to clean. Country of Origin: Made in Korea
customer_reviews.author: QN

customer_reviews.title: BEST  FABULOUS PAN
customer_reviews.text: I use this pan allot I make pan cakes and they just flow right out of the pan....does not stick. It makes making Breakfast such a joy....they cook up quick and there basically no clean up either. I bought one for my daugherand she is thrilled. She makes hamburgers etc for her family and it is making her cooking time enjoyable because of the clean up also
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Start every day with a smile
customer_reviews.text: This is the most used piece of cookware in our kitchen and it' does the trick. Perfect for onsen tamago or any omlette. Even heat distribution and nonstick surface let you roll, or flip, your eggs with ease. Will probably look for other non-stick cookware from this manufacturer when I'm next in the market.
customer_reviews.author: DrTeeth

customer_reviews.title: It came SCRATCHED!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked to see that it came with scratch marks. I didn't check the condition of the pan when opening the package. Being on a Marie Kondo spree recently, I unfortunately, threw away the packaging, before I saw the marks. Not sure if I can return it. Fortunately, it's not that expensive so even if Amazon refuses to replace it, it's not the end of the world for me. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Came with chip but good quality
customer_reviews.text: I order the medium size one. It is perfect for my temakisushi. It did come with a dent/chip on the edge of the pan. I don't want to go through the trouble of returning it so I plan ok keeping it, considering it's at a great price. We'll see if it can handle some usage.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Hannah

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pan for a month or two. Even poor quality pans last that long. So I can't say yet whether this will be a long term durable pan or not, but so far so good! Good heat distribution. The nonstick is holding strong. Cleaning it can be a bit tricky. Haven't totally mastered it. But overall I'm fairly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: The "medium" is actually a "small"
customer_reviews.text: The "medium" omelet pan is very, very small - the cooking area is the size of a mass market paperback. It appears more useful for standalone burners or for specialty cooking. Get the "large" instead; the size is just right for anything. I have both.
customer_reviews.author: catnip033

customer_reviews.title: Great omelette pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pan. I use it for making omelettes, the rectangular shape means I make the perfect sized omelette every time. I've also used this pan when making scrambled eggs, grilled cheese, and panini sandwiches. The pan heats quickly and evenly. Definitely no need for high heat settings, just use low or medium as the instructions recommend. The handle is comfortable and does not get hot. Clean up is easy. This pan is very well made and has a beautiful exterior color.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Excellant tamago pan, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Well built heavy gage metal pan with a slight angular tilt to help with the formation of the omlett. I followed the instructions of seasoning the pan before the first use. Slight learning curve to get a well shaped tamago omlett. I have used several times now and have perfected the tamago form, thickness, and uniformity. Use just a small brush of oil with each use. Cleans up very easily with just water and a soft brush or cloth- no soap , hard brush or metal spatula. Still playing around with receipes to get the perfect taste.
customer_reviews.author: Y. M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Got more than tamago use from this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this thing nonstop on a single induction cooker. Good quality/sturdy. I bought this with the intention to make tamago, but it works perfectly for omelets when you use the same techniques. It's my go-to for scrambled eggs, too. This is one of my most used pans now.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the smaller pan to use for tamagoyaki breakfasts and it has surpassed my expectations. This little pan has some weight to it! It evenly distributes the heat (perfect for my finicky electric stovetop), easy to clean, easy to handle, and makes the perfect tamagoyaki portion (2 eggs with vegetables.)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Japanese style egg fry
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. This is non-stick pan, easy to clean and perfect size for single or small family. If you have more than 4 people in your family, large size would be for you. I got it on amazon prime day, and this is the greatest buy ever !
customer_reviews.author: Kryskhloe

customer_reviews.title: TeChef products are undoubtedly the best ones I've ever used in the United States comparing ...
customer_reviews.text: TeChef products are undoubtedly the best ones I've ever used in the United States comparing to other of similar price. Well-made. You can feel the quality when you receive it. Quickly heated and this one makes perfect Japanese omelette (a lot of practices are required of course). I also bought a frying pan and pot from TeChef after buying this and tossed the old pan and pot right away.
customer_reviews.author: Arvin

customer_reviews.title: Medium pan is perfect for one.
customer_reviews.text: This skillet feels great and is obviously well made. I bought the "medium" pan, which is quite small, but as a single guy, this is the perfect size. I'll just make more than one rolled omelette if I have guests. The silicone spatula in the picture was also bought from Amazon and it is like it was made for this pan--it fits perfectly with less than a half inch of space.
customer_reviews.author: OK, Cliff!

customer_reviews.title: takes heat evenly on glass top
customer_reviews.text: Real live Japanese omelet rolled layer after layer with goodies. Try crepes rolled layer after layer after layer. Yum!!!
customer_reviews.author: BPORTER72

customer_reviews.title: Not as nonstick as adverstised.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once but was disappointed that the eggs stuck to the pan, even after it was oiled. Did clean easily. Can't attest to its durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: G Liza

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent rolled Japanese omelettes!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a pan like this for some time. I enjoy making omelettes and being able to make a rolled Japanese style omelette has fun! It's been great to experiment with different omelette fillings. I purchased the smaller size and it is perfect for the two of us. Frankly, even if I had kids I would still go with the smaller pan (just make two batches duh..). I've also used it to make sweet omelettes that I use with homemade sushi. It's says dishwasher safe but I would never put any non-stick pan in my dishwasher and only hand wash. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect omelets
customer_reviews.text: Best pan I have ever used to make omelets. The rectangular shape seems key to its success. Heats quickly - no need for high temperature settings. Very easy to clean. Good handle. I bought the medium size and possibly should have bought the large. The medium sizecworks well for two-egg omelets with multiple extra ingredients (eg bell peppers, broccoli, onions, cheese). With 3 eggs plus multiple extra ingredients, I have to be a bit more careful. I have only been using this pan for only six weeks so I cannot comment on performance in the long term.
customer_reviews.author: jdcohn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for two people.
customer_reviews.text: I love the pan. it's larger than my other one and perfect to make one omelet for two people. My only problem is that, after the first use, it developed a small 1/4" spot where the non-stick coating flaked off. I'm sure the company, TeChef, will replace it. They have an excellent reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Spruce  Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great for Japanese Omelettes
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We learned to cook Japanese omelettes in Japan, but did not have room to bring back a pan. This one has very effective nonstick so the clean up is easy. The only difficult part is making the omelette... I am still not very good at flipping it or using the cooking chopsticks.
customer_reviews.author: Smiling Face

customer_reviews.title: Great frying pan for any purpose
customer_reviews.text: Since eggs are one of my favorite foods I had to purchase one of these frying pans and try it out myself. My first attempt at making a tamagoyaki (rolled omelette) were fairly successful and the results were delicious. I also use it for making regular scrambled eggs since it is, after all, a frying pan, just a rectangular one. The non-stick coating works very well and it cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: GMakTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and clean, works great with Minchsrin Silicone & Nylon Fish Spatula Wide Turner (
customer_reviews.author: Watabu

customer_reviews.title: Great pan!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is fantastic! I was surprised at how good looking it was when I first opened the box. It's a very pretty purple color and the bottom has a very interesting pattern. It looks nice hanging with my other pans. The nonstick on this pan is fabulous. I use a little bit of oil when making my tamagoyaki and I haven't had sticking problems at all. I use wooden chopsticks when cooking. I always handwash and hand dry when finished. No problems with damaged coating. It really is wonderful... If you are thinking about getting any other tamagoyaki pan from Amazon... don't! Get this one. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Baron Von Chicken Pants

customer_reviews.title: Nice frying pan
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace another tamagoyaki frying pan, the teflon coating was worn away. Anyway, this pan is nice. It's a bit thicker than my old one. Bottom has this funky heat distribution lines in the bottom. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and makes beautiful tamagoyaki
customer_reviews.text: When I first took it out of the package I was a little skeptical about the size, but it's genuinely the perfect size and shape to make 3 egg tamagoyaki. The egg slides around in it easily without sticking, and it conducts heat really evenly. I can even use this for small (2 egg) omelette rice! If omelette rice is your main goal or you'll be making a lot of tamagoyaki, I recommend the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Don't get this
customer_reviews.text: The pan warped in the middle the very first time i used it. Now the oil falls to the sides and egg gets stuck in the middle of the pan. Not happy with this pan....so cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: LA girl

customer_reviews.title: Love This Pan
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!!!!!!! I've been using it for months and I have nothing negative to say about it! Nothing ever sticks to it, so clean up is a breeze. The omelettes come out so fluffy and gigantic. I bought one for two of my friends, an they love theirs also! Great buy! Highly recommended! Went back and bought one for 2 of my friends. They love it also!
customer_reviews.author: AJay_89

customer_reviews.title: great pan
customer_reviews.text: I have only made tamagoyaki a couple times but this pan works great. The non-stick is excellent and I have no trouble flipping the egg. My Wife uses it for her grilled cheese sandwiches and loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I've been making tamagoyaki in a regular round pan for years and I can't believe the difference this makes. It's so much easier. I can't go back to a regular pan at this point! And the color is cute too.
customer_reviews.author: Heather FL

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: works great for personal sized tamagoyaki. For more than 1 person, would choose a larger size
customer_reviews.author: PR

customer_reviews.title: Met our expectations
customer_reviews.text: My husband is the cook in the house and has such fun making rolled eggs in this skillet. It works great, cleans easy, and does exactly what we hoped it would. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: drynard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pan
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pan for making the square sheets of eggs for making Korean kimbab rolls or making rolled egg dish. Use it mostly on my gas rangetop but also works great on my tabletop induction burner.
customer_reviews.author: Maui Kim

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: The surface is a little sticky after cooking. But overall is good
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Just a nice little Tamagoyaki pan
customer_reviews.text: It holds heat well and seems to distribute it very evenly. The handle seems very well secured as well. The density of the pan is very noticeable and quick thick, giving it a durable feel.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Raxter

customer_reviews.title: Weak coating or defective
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a shallow scratch already but I didn’t mind that too much, but I should have returned it while I could. The coating gave up on my third time using the pan. I only used low heat, silicon or wooden spatula, and soft part of the sponge when washing it, yet the pan got scratches that revealed the aluminum underneath. What an expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah K

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for omelets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an omelet pan for my teenage son. He LOVES it. It distributes heat well, it needs little maintenance (don't put it in the dishwasher!) The only odd thing is the shape, but it is great for folding eggs, as you actually have sides to work with. I'd buy it again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: BKMartin

customer_reviews.title: Burned our fingers for the last time
customer_reviews.text: The pan itself cooks fine, but the handle design is terrible. We have burned our fingers multiple times by accidentally grabbing the metal portion of the handle where it meets the plastic. It feels like the natural place to grab the handle to balance the pan. The metal is too thick and draws a ton of heat into the handle. It would be better if the metal part was thinner than the actual plastic handle like all of the other pans in our cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: asromzek

customer_reviews.title: A bit large, Laos the delicacy of the smaller one-of pan for one
customer_reviews.text: The size is the issue. If you, an American, want an omelet that large, use a round pan. Or use the smaller Japanese pan for the popular small omelet pan as seen on tv.
customer_reviews.author: evan1138

customer_reviews.title: We got this for our Granddaughter's 12th birthday.  She really loves it.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our Granddaughter's 12th birthday. She really loves it. She has used it several times and is experimenting with different recipes which turn out great.
customer_reviews.author: MN_EE

customer_reviews.title: Great quality; easy to make 2-egg omelettes or dashiyaki.
customer_reviews.text: Non-stick, as the product description says. Easy to clean and has a unique color, too. I use it mostly to make omelettes and pancakes; nothing too greasy, since it was hard to scrub off the bacon stains on my old square pan.
customer_reviews.author: Damien474

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, great little pan
customer_reviews.text: Love this little pan!! I was able to make a successful tamagoyaki first try with this pan!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: So far is good
customer_reviews.text: This pan works on my counter top Duxtop induction cooktop. The circular steel insert visibly telegraphed through very quickly, but it hasn't affected the non-stick surface. The pan is so lightweight that it is easy to bump it around on the cooktop surface.
customer_reviews.author: robit

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. it has opened up a whole new rectangular world for me when making Tamagoyaki. I have no similar pan to compare it to but for occasional use I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: fulltimer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the perfect tamago!
customer_reviews.text: If you make tamago you know that you need the right pan for it. This one is the best I have had. It distributes heat well, is the perfect depth and is obviously non-stick—as well as being at the right price. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: "kwist"

customer_reviews.title: Don’t soak in water!
customer_reviews.text: I soaked it in water for an hour and put it in the dishwasher, and the color at button of the pan started fading, I think I got a defective one :(
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for low heat japanese style omelettes
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for low heat japanese style omelettes! I also use this to cook other things all the time since the other pan I have is a large14 inch pan and I don't need such a large pan when cooking for 2.
customer_reviews.author: J.C088

customer_reviews.title: Made tamagoyaki easily with this!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once so far but I'm very impressed. This really makes it easy to make tamagoyaki. Nothing sticks to it, and the heat is distributed well. Can be used with IC heaters too! Just don't put it in the dish washer.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: scratches already
customer_reviews.text: I use very carefully each time and it just had scratches anyway. the square shape is not practical to turn the omelette over. this pan is too big and wide. the rectangular one is better.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Gall

customer_reviews.title: If you raise chickens ,this is your pan !!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it !! .. I raise chickens so we have a lot of eggs , and this is the best product for eggs ,thank you. Can't wait to buy another pan from yenz
customer_reviews.author: From the sticks

customer_reviews.title: Well built and attractive!
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered to replace a similar older pan by another manufacturer the was loosing its stick-free coating. The TeChef omelette pan is very well built and far superior to the older pan. Sturdy, good heat distribution, well designed handle and my wife and I really like the exterior color. Just the right size for grilled sandwiches. She now wants to purchase other TeChef pans to match.
customer_reviews.author: MrBill610

customer_reviews.title: I like everything about this pan but
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this pan but.....the metal part of the handle that attaches to the pan turns everything it touches black - your hands, a paper towel, anything.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stone

customer_reviews.title: New is fine, but time will tell
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pan of this type and so far it has performed as expected. The heat distribution is ok and the eggs don’t stick to the pan, but I do use a vegetable spray in this type of frying. Overall, I do recommend the pan, but I will have to use it for a few months in order to provide a thorough review. New things generally perform as expected and it is usually after months of use when a better verdict is revealed.
customer_reviews.author: thegrabbag

customer_reviews.title: Just Great - also very easy over,too...
customer_reviews.text: Looks muted, but close examination reveals a rugged looking surface - works beautifully - eggs slide easily - and with a little more practice, my next one might be perfect. [No Holes] Really fun! Cleans up fantastically! My new go-to any egg pan! [And I eat a lot of them] You can slide them right out! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this pan the perfect size for a manageable Tamagoyaki , it is also great for making grilled cheese sandwiches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to morning routine
customer_reviews.text: I was suprised on how easy it was to make omelets in this pan, not just Tamagoyaki but regular omelets as well. My wife who is very particular about how her eggs are cooked (no browning allowed) has been very happy with the omelets I have made her so far which I think is testament to it's heat distribution and quality. The first few Tamagoyaki were a little tricky to get the amount of egg right but now it's easier than making a conventional omelet. I am very happy with this product and have recommended it to friends and family who like me enjoy a nice fluffy omelet in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Noelia

customer_reviews.title: Small is perfect for 1-2 people
customer_reviews.text: I just made tamagoyaki for the first time and I doubt it would have been nearly as successful without this pan. It was really easy to use and easy to clean. Definitely read the size dementions before ordering, obviously it's the size they say it is but I have a bad concept of size so it was smaller than I thought. For the small pan it makes one good size omlet at a time, so perfect for one person or as a side for two people.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Klipera

customer_reviews.title: Vegas kitchen tested!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE my pan! I use it at work 3-5 times a week. Heat distribution is decent, does have a tendency to get a little hotter in the middle, even when I have it on low and off to the side. Must use pan spray a lot! But other than that, my tamago comes out great every time!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Ryan Tamez

customer_reviews.title: I can make rolled omelets.
customer_reviews.text: I can make rolled omelets now. Very easy to use if you follow simple directions. Lots of good videos online to show you how to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J. Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Non stick pan??
customer_reviews.text: I read all the great reviews and decide to buy this pan. Just used once with my wooden chopstick, it already got a scratch marks on the pan and it is not non-stick what others claims. It sticks to my pan and I have to spray oil. Handle is pretty sturdy though.
customer_reviews.author: ctj

customer_reviews.title: small, nonstick. Simple. Easy
customer_reviews.text: So far. So good. I do not use it that often but it works like a dream. Its quite small. More of a 1 person tamagoyaki size cooking. Whole families should get larger
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Eby

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan makes great 2 egg tamoyaki. Our family loves it. Also very easy to clean. If you want to make a larger tamoyaki I would recommend the bigger size one though.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Korpenfelt

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy this again, but don’t think I’ll ever have to!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this little pan for a long time now, use it almost everyday, and it’s still in perfect condition. I usually use a little oil in the pan, but even when I don’t, nothing sticks. It’s a great pan especially since it’s so cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty M.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pan
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pan, easy to use and clean. Properly used this lets me make wonderful Japanese style omelets; Practice makes perfect. I have the regular and large size. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: David Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Durable, easy to clean, makes perfect tamagoyaki! I wasn't sure at first if I really wanted to buy a specific pan just tor this, but I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Sedlar

customer_reviews.title: and it is so much fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tamagoyaki nabe, and it is so much fun to use! Learning to make the rolled omelettes has been so much fun, and I've been making them frequently for myself and my mother and friends. It's nice because rolled omelettes in general, are much prettier than a standard American omelette. Cleaning this pan is super easy, and I haven't had any issues with things sticking. Definitely recommend this to others!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Nofi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean. Best pan for tamagoyaki, or gyeranmari
customer_reviews.text: I am glad that i can find something Made in Korea. Of course sturdy. Hear distribution is good Absolutely easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: sun

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this little pan. I've used it for more than just tamagoyaki too since it's really easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Good small pan for lots of uses
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an egg pan but we have used it for hot dogs, small portions of sautéed veggies, slider burgers and more----glad we bought it! Easy to clean as well.....
customer_reviews.author: John R. Haverty

customer_reviews.title: The best egg pan
customer_reviews.text: The best egg pan I've ever bought I don't know what the hell I was thinking not getting it sooner
customer_reviews.author: IFNLOV

customer_reviews.title: Scratches on the sides
customer_reviews.text: Did not expect it to be small but I am giving 3 stars because of the quality of the product. There are scratches on the side of the pan as shown on the pictures. I know it won’t affect the cooking of eggs but this is not the product quality promised or as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene B.

customer_reviews.title: poor heat conductor
customer_reviews.text: Takes a long time to heat up. Heat ,at the beggining is concentrated in the center and not the edges.
customer_reviews.author: ton

customer_reviews.title: It will work the very first time.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I watched a video on- line and turned out a perfect rolled omelette the very first time. It’s easy. Just start to roll before the layers are fully set. The result is a light, fluffy, egg roll.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Stroud

customer_reviews.title: Awesome find!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my friend who really wanted to make this dish. The color was gorgeous as well!
customer_reviews.author: smvalek

customer_reviews.title: Tamagoyaki
customer_reviews.text: I like making tamagoyaki and this pan helps a lot! I also use this for pancakes and just regular type of cooking eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee B

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!  I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: Chef says she loves it! I love the perfectly sized omelettes my little chef makes for me using it. It is purple, easy to clean, easy to use, convenient size, all together that means I get great omelettes anytime I want.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Good little nonstick pan
customer_reviews.text: Too small for most cooking applications. Going to scramble an egg or two with easy clean up. You're OK... Good quality in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: JB Caring Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. I bought it because I cook a ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I bought it because I cook a lot of eggs and I needed smaller size pan that's not sticking.. I made a Korean Gaeranmali (계란말이) on this pan....and it was super easy! If you have this pan..you don't need any skill.. This is awesome product...I don't necessarily leave any review....but I want you to buy this..maybe you don't have to...I will keep buy this brand <3
customer_reviews.author: baijieling

product_meta.title: TeChef - Tamagoyaki Japanese Omelette Pan/Egg Pan, Coated with New Safe Teflon Select - Colour Collection/Non-Stick Coating (PFOA Free) / (Aubergine Purple) / Made in Korea (Medium)
feature_bullets: Long Life Nonstick - New Safe PFOA Free Teflon Select with new, proprietary and patented scratch resistance technology
Specialty - an unique sloped shape allows for easy flipping of omelets, sandwiches, and pancakes
Safe new Teflon coating (No PFOA) - new Teflon nonstick coating are made without using PFOA and are affirmed safe for cooking by regulatory agencies worldwide
Induction-ready with heavy base - INDUCTION-CAPABLE extra-heavy gauge aluminum construction with stainless steel base
Made in Korea - Delivers outstanding performance and exceptional quality
